content: Xiangmin Fan | ISCAS Xiangmin Fan ·¶ÏòÃñ Ph.D., Associate Professor Beijing Key Lab of Human-Computer Interaction Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Sciences (ISCAS) Co-Founder and CEO of CAS-Ruiyi (ÖÐ¿Æî£Ò½) 4 Zhongguancun South 4th Street Beijing 100190, China Email: xiangmin AT iscas.ac.cn Xiangmin Fan is a co-founder and the CEO of CAS-Ruiyi (ÖÐ¿Æî£Ò½)£¬a leading healthcare technology company focusing on early detection, diagnosis, and treatment of neurological diseases. He is also an Associate Professor of the Beijing Key Lab of Human-Computer Interaction at the Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Sciences. Xiangmin is supported by the Hundred Talents Plan of Chinese Academy of Sciences. He is appointed as an ACM Distinguished Speaker (request a lecture), and the Chair of ACM SIGCHI China Chapter. Xiangmin's research lies in the general area of Human Computer Interaction (HCI), with a primary focus on using both more traditional HCI approaches and cutting-edge AI techniques to improve the interaction and collaboration between humans and machines. He has authored over forty publications in premier HCI venues such as CHI, UIST, Ubicomp, and CSCW. His recent works received Honorable Mention Awards of ACM CHI 2019 and ACM CHI 2020, the flagship conference in HCI. Xiangmin received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Pittsburgh, and Bachelor degree in Computer Science from Shandong University.
